intro: Mammea eugenioides, commonly known as the African snowball, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a small to medium-sized tree or shrub that can grow up to 10 meters tall, with a dense canopy of dark green leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white, fragrant flowers that bloom in spring, followed by orange or red berries. It has a fibrous root system and thrives in well-drained soils, often found in coastal areas and disturbed sites. The leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a waxy texture, contributing to its adaptability in various climates.
